description: From Middle English versus, borrowed from Latin versus (“facing”), past participle of vertere (“to turn, change, overthrow, destroy”).

examples: It is the Packers versus the Steelers in the Super Bowl.

entries.meaning: (law) Bringing a legal action against, as used in the title of a court case in which the first party indicates the plaintiff (or appellant or the like), and the second indicates the defendant (or respondent or the like).
examples: Brown v. Board of Education of Topeka, Kans.
